repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Tufts Dining Action Coalition, 2019, accession MS-2019-070.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one series in the order in which it was received.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tufts Dining Action Coalition is a student organization founded in early 2018 in response to Tufts dining workers' efforts to unionize. Tufts Dining Action Coalition supported the dining workers by organizing events in support of unionization and contract negotiation efforts and educating other Tufts students about the dining workers' campaign.

Tufts Dining Action Coalition actions included organizing rallies, pickets, and worker speak-outs; phone banks to Tufts administrators; speaking out at an alumni event; placing banners around campus; and organizing in solidarity with other labor actions in the Boston area. Specific issues that Tufts Dining Action Coalition and dining workers focused on were healthcare, respect in the workplace, and freedom from discrimination and exploitation.
In October 2019, Tufts Dining Action Coalition joined the Tufts Activism Coalition, an umbrella organization formed to coordinate activities and share organizational tools.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tufts Dining Action Coalition Records, circa 2018 -- 2019. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in Spring 2020.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records of the Tufts Dining Action Coalition (TDAC) and includes buttons, fliers, news articles, notes, and an organizing notebook. The records date from 2018 to 2019.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have not been transferred to Tufts University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains the following issues: The Somerville Times, March 6, 2019 and The Tufts Daily, August 29, 2018; January 24, 2019; February 7, 2019; March 4, 2019; March 5, 2019; March 6, 2019. Please note that the August 29, 2018 and January 24, 2019 issues are not available as part of UP029, the Tufts Daily collection.
